trans-unit.source: Learn how to secure back-end services using client certificate authentication in Azure API Management.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to secure back-end services using client certificate authentication in Azure API Management.

trans-unit.source: How to secure back-end services using client certificate authentication in Azure API Management
trans-unit.target: How to secure back-end services using client certificate authentication in Azure API Management

trans-unit.source: API Management provides the capability to secure access to the back-end service of an API using client certificates.
trans-unit.target: API Management provides the capability to secure access to the back-end service of an API using client certificates.

trans-unit.source: This guide shows how to manage certificates in the API publisher portal, and how to configure an API to use a certificate to access its back-end service.
trans-unit.target: This guide shows how to manage certificates in the API publisher portal, and how to configure an API to use a certificate to access its back-end service.

trans-unit.source: For information about managing certificates using the API Management REST API, see [Azure API Management REST API Certificate entity][].
trans-unit.target: For information about managing certificates using the API Management REST API, see [Azure API Management REST API Certificate entity][].

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: This guide shows you how to configure your API Management service instance to use client certificate authentication to access the back-end service for an API.
trans-unit.target: This guide shows you how to configure your API Management service instance to use client certificate authentication to access the back-end service for an API.

trans-unit.source: Before following the steps in this topic, you should have your back-end service configured for client certificate authentication, and have access to the certificate and the password for the certificate for uploading in the API Management publisher portal.
trans-unit.target: Before following the steps in this topic, you should have your back-end service configured for client certificate authentication, and have access to the certificate and the password for the certificate for uploading in the API Management publisher portal.

trans-unit.source: Upload a client certificate
trans-unit.target: Upload a client certificate

trans-unit.source: To get started, click **Manage** in the Azure Classic Portal for your API Management service.
trans-unit.target: To get started, click **Manage** in the Azure Classic Portal for your API Management service.

trans-unit.source: This takes you to the API Management publisher portal.
trans-unit.target: This takes you to the API Management publisher portal.

trans-unit.source: ![API Publisher portal][api-management-management-console]
trans-unit.target: ![API Publisher portal][api-management-management-console]

trans-unit.source: If you have not yet created an API Management service instance, see [Create an API Management service instance][] in the [Get started with Azure API Management][] tutorial.
trans-unit.target: If you have not yet created an API Management service instance, see [Create an API Management service instance][] in the [Get started with Azure API Management][] tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Click **Security** from the **API Management** menu on the left, and click **Client certificates**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Security** from the **API Management** menu on the left, and click **Client certificates**.

trans-unit.source: ![Client certificates][api-management-security-client-certificates]
trans-unit.target: ![Client certificates][api-management-security-client-certificates]

trans-unit.source: To upload a new certificate, click **Upload certificate**.
trans-unit.target: To upload a new certificate, click **Upload certificate**.

trans-unit.source: ![Upload certificate][api-management-upload-certificate]
trans-unit.target: ![Upload certificate][api-management-upload-certificate]

trans-unit.source: Browse to your certificate, and then enter the password for the certificate.
trans-unit.target: Browse to your certificate, and then enter the password for the certificate.

trans-unit.source: The certificate must be in **.pfx** format.
trans-unit.target: The certificate must be in **.pfx** format.

trans-unit.source: Self-signed certificates are allowed.
trans-unit.target: Self-signed certificates are allowed.

trans-unit.source: ![Upload certificate][api-management-upload-certificate-form]
trans-unit.target: ![Upload certificate][api-management-upload-certificate-form]

trans-unit.source: Click **Upload** to upload the certificate.
trans-unit.target: Click **Upload** to upload the certificate.

trans-unit.source: The certificate password is validated at this time.
trans-unit.target: The certificate password is validated at this time.

trans-unit.source: If it is incorrect an error message is displayed.
trans-unit.target: If it is incorrect an error message is displayed.

trans-unit.source: ![Certificate uploaded][api-management-certificate-uploaded]
trans-unit.target: ![Certificate uploaded][api-management-certificate-uploaded]

trans-unit.source: Once the certificate is uploaded, it appears on the **Client certificates** tab.
trans-unit.target: Once the certificate is uploaded, it appears on the **Client certificates** tab.

trans-unit.source: If you have multiple certificates, make a note of the subject, or the last four characters of the thumbprint, which are used to select the certificate when configuring an API to use certificates, as covered in the following [Configure an API to use a client certificate for gateway authentication][] section.
trans-unit.target: If you have multiple certificates, make a note of the subject, or the last four characters of the thumbprint, which are used to select the certificate when configuring an API to use certificates, as covered in the following [Configure an API to use a client certificate for gateway authentication][] section.

trans-unit.source: Delete a client certificate
trans-unit.target: Delete a client certificate

trans-unit.source: To delete a certificate, click **Delete** beside the desired certificate.
trans-unit.target: To delete a certificate, click **Delete** beside the desired certificate.

trans-unit.source: ![Delete certificate][api-management-certificate-delete]
trans-unit.target: ![Delete certificate][api-management-certificate-delete]

trans-unit.source: Click **Yes, delete it** to confirm.
trans-unit.target: Click **Yes, delete it** to confirm.

trans-unit.source: ![Confirm delete][api-management-confirm-delete]
trans-unit.target: ![Confirm delete][api-management-confirm-delete]

trans-unit.source: If the certificate is in use by an API, then a warning screen is displayed.
trans-unit.target: If the certificate is in use by an API, then a warning screen is displayed.

trans-unit.source: To delete the certificate you must first remove the certificate from any APIs that are configured to use it.
trans-unit.target: To delete the certificate you must first remove the certificate from any APIs that are configured to use it.

trans-unit.source: ![Confirm delete][api-management-confirm-delete-policy]
trans-unit.target: ![Confirm delete][api-management-confirm-delete-policy]

trans-unit.source: Configure an API to use a client certificate for gateway authentication
trans-unit.target: Configure an API to use a client certificate for gateway authentication

trans-unit.source: Click **APIs** from the **API Management** menu on the left, click the name of the desired API, and click the **Security** tab.
trans-unit.target: Click **APIs** from the **API Management** menu on the left, click the name of the desired API, and click the **Security** tab.

trans-unit.source: ![API security][api-management-api-security]
trans-unit.target: ![API security][api-management-api-security]

trans-unit.source: Select **Client certificates** from the **With credentials** drop-down list.
trans-unit.target: Select **Client certificates** from the **With credentials** drop-down list.

trans-unit.source: ![Client certificates][api-management-mutual-certificates]
trans-unit.target: ![Client certificates][api-management-mutual-certificates]

trans-unit.source: Select the desired certificate from the **Client certificate** drop-down list.
trans-unit.target: Select the desired certificate from the **Client certificate** drop-down list.

trans-unit.source: If there are multiple certificates you can look at the subject or the last four characters of the thumbprint as noted in the previous section to determine the correct certificate.
trans-unit.target: If there are multiple certificates you can look at the subject or the last four characters of the thumbprint as noted in the previous section to determine the correct certificate.

trans-unit.source: ![Select certificate][api-management-select-certificate]
trans-unit.target: ![Select certificate][api-management-select-certificate]

trans-unit.source: Click **Save** to save the configuration change to the API.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save** to save the configuration change to the API.

trans-unit.source: This change is effective immediately, and calls to operations of that API will use the certificate to authenticate on the back-end server.
trans-unit.target: This change is effective immediately, and calls to operations of that API will use the certificate to authenticate on the back-end server.

trans-unit.source: ![Save API changes][api-management-save-api]
trans-unit.target: ![Save API changes][api-management-save-api]

trans-unit.source: When a certificate is specified for gateway authentication for the back-end service of an API, it becomes part of the policy for that API, and can be viewed in the policy editor.
trans-unit.target: When a certificate is specified for gateway authentication for the back-end service of an API, it becomes part of the policy for that API, and can be viewed in the policy editor.

trans-unit.source: ![Certificate policy][api-management-certificate-policy]
trans-unit.target: ![Certificate policy][api-management-certificate-policy]
